item.title: Metal fence about to collapse, 9th November
item.description:
The metal fencing around Bedonwell Road open space is very shaky. Itâ€™s going to collapse if someone leans on it. And itâ€™s rusty and sharp. The whole fence is very dangerous as itâ€™s so precarious. I can wobble it back and forth.

item.title: To the right of the driveway of the Harben Road Estate, 9th November
item.description:
The road has raised and the tarmac surface has cracked. It has caused a trip hazard. I am disabled and caught my foot on it and tripped over. Resulting in spending a day in A&E University College Hospital, undertaking a number of tests and being x-rayed to ensure there was no broken bones. 3 X Photos have been attached for reference.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harben Road, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy barking dogs constantly left in garden, 9th November
item.description:
The house on the corner of Gerda Road/Southwood Road has dogs that are an ongoing public nuisance, and have been for well over a year. They constantly bark in the garden late into the evening, and this repeatedly wakes ups my young children.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Southwood Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
